sen.j: 観世清長（かんぜ きよなが、- 1842年（天保13年）とは、シテ方観世流能楽師。
sen.e: Kiyonaga Kanze (died 1842) was a Noh actor who played shite-kata (main roles) in the Kanze school.
Kiyonaga Kanze (died 1842) was a Noh actor who played shite-kata (main roles) in the Kanze school.
Kiyonaga KANZE (died 1842) was a Noh actor who played shite-kata (main roles) in the Kanze school.
He was the twenty-first head of the Kanze family.
He was the twenty-first head of the Kanze family.
He was the twenty-first head of the Kanze family.
He went by the name Sakon Kanze.
He went by the name Sakon Kanze.
He went by the name Sakon KANZE.

sen.j: 幸橋門外で十五日の勧進能を催す。
sen.e: He held a fifteen-day Kanjin noh (performances held to raise subscriptions for the construction of shrines or temples) outside the gate of Saiwai-bashi Bridge.
He held a fifteen-day Kanjin noh (performances held to raise subscriptions for the construction of shrines or temples) outside the gate of Saiwai-bashi Bridge.
He held a fifteen-day Kanjin noh (performances held to raise subscriptions for the construction of shrines or temples) outside the gate of Saiwai-bashi Bridge.

sen.j: 好評であったので日延べ、江戸期最長の二十五日間の興行となった。
sen.e: Because the performances were so well received, it was extended for a total of twenty-five days, becoming the longest Kanijin noh performance in the Edo Period.
Because the performances were so well received, it was extended for a total of twenty-five days, becoming the longest Kanijin noh performance in the Edo Period.
Because the performances were so well received, it was extended for a total of twenty-five days, becoming the longest Kanijin noh performance in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更

sen.j: 子に二十二世宗家観世清孝。
sen.e: He had a child, Kiyotaka KANZE, who became the twenty-second head of the family.
He had a child, Kiyotaka KANZE, who became the twenty-second head of the family.
He had a child, Kiyotaka KANZE, who became the twenty-second head of the family.
